page.title: 16LOCAL MEMORIES
page.content:
Mrs Cartlidge:"The army Barracks in Leek were up Ashbourne Road,they have been knocked down now and an estate built."
Mrs Birch:"Lots of local people went to Rudyard Lake for walks,but now hardly anyone goes."
Mrs Trafford:"The Wallbridge estate used be muddy fields,and now it's a big housing estate."
Mrs Emery:"During the war all the people down Westwood Terace had to look outy { out for fires whenever the siren went. One night when they bombed Coventry they had to go round with a whistle and blow it if they saw a fire.The planes came and dropped a bomb on Nun Street and a man was killed on the stairs.
